data.title: The Mirror Has Two Faces
data.meta_description: I haven’t seen the 1958 Andre Cayatte feature this 1996 Barbra Streisand picture is based on, but given the usual glumness of that writer-director—a former lawyer and the French equivalent of Stanley Kramer—I wouldn’t have expected such lightheartedness. Adapted by Richard LaGravenese (The Fisher King) and directed by Streisand, this is a quirky romantic comedy […]
data.text:
Review: Bad Press

Bad Press takes a candid and deeply compelling look at the struggle for unimpeded reporting within the Muscogee (Creek) Nation.

Review: Close Your Eyes

Spanish director Victor Erice considers the spirit of cinema itself in Close Your Eyes.

Review: The Clean Up Crew

The Clean-Up Crew is a joyous, campy heist mess.

Review: Between the Temples

With both misery and comedy, director Nathan Silver satisfyingly captures the Jewish experience.

Riverbeast alert

The Music Box Theatre will screen Don’t Let the Riverbeast Get You!, a campy cult classic by eccentric filmmaker and musician Matt Farley.
